title: Little Mix have their naughty X factor
text:
Email a friend 
LITTLE Mix reveal their XXX Factor on new album Get Weird with Jade Thirlwall admitting she blushes when she is asked to recite some of their lyrics. 
You can also expect Perrie Edwards, with the help of her besties Thirlwall, Jesy Nelson and Leigh-­Anne Pinnock to address her break-up with former One Direction bad boy Zayn Malik on the record. 
The vivacious British girl group will head to Australia on October 12 to spruik the new record and latest single, the 60s girl group-flavoured Love Me Like You . 
The first single Black Magic peaked at No. 8 on the Australian charts. 
But it is potential next single A.D.I.D.A.S. , which is not about the famed active wear brand but an acronym for All Day I Dream About Sex., that will be steaming up the airwaves. Active wear ... Little Mix offer up their sexy side on songs like A.D.I.D.A.S. Picture: Sony Music. Source: Supplied 
“Perrie keeps forcing me to say the lyrics because she likes to see me squirm; look at Twitter, I don’t want to say them out loud!” Thirwall said. 
“When my mum first heard it, she said ‘Jade, you are not releasing that song” but we’re adults now, we’ve had relationships and we can be naughty.” 
She joked that the song’s title was a blatant attempt to win Little Mix an ADIDAS endorsement. 
“Bring that on! Now I have to write a song called Cheezels and Puma because I like them too,” she said. 
Thirwall said along with Get Weird ’s adult content, there will be the inevitable “songs about break-ups”. The video for Love Me Like You features a lookalike for Malik. 
She said the hectic schedule of Little Mix’s promotional duties throughout the UK was helping to mend Edwards’ broken heart. 
“She’s good. We’re very lucky we have each other whatever happens and our main thing will always be our friendship because whenever something happens in our personal lives, that is all that matters,” Thirwall said. 60s sound ... Little Mix borrow inspiration from the Phil Spector girl groups for Love Me Like You single. Picture: Joel Ryan/Invision/AP. Source: AP 
Their latest single Love Me Like You is another 1960s pop flashback, reminiscent of the Phil Spector girl groups and the retro sound which has sent Meghan Trainor ( Lips Are Movin’ ) and Grace ( You Don’t Own Me ) to the top of the charts worldwide. 
The Get Weird record will also feature co-writes with some of their favourite artists including Jessie J and Jess Glynne. 
Thirlwall said some of the world’s hitmakers have been shocked to discover how heavily they were involved with the arrangements of the songs they performed when they contested X Factor in 2011 and their writing chops. 
LISTEN TO OUR PODCAST ON THE BACHELORETTE 
“I think now we have cemented our place in the pop industry and been one of the bigger acts (from X Factor) but we won’t stop until we ‘ve made it everywhere, especially in America,” she said. 
“Australia has been so massive for us and we can’t wait to see all the fans again.” 
Little Mix are expected to perform on X Factor in Australia and hold some in-store signing sessions to promote the release of Get Weird on November 9.
